title: Autobiography of Mrs. Fletcher.
author: Fletcher
snippet: As the spring approaclied, now* that we were free of Park Hall, and also of the Coilrt of Session, we were more able to wander, and our excellent friend Mrs. Grant of Laggan recommended Callander to us as a pleasant residence within easy reach of many Highland beauties ; and early in the summer of 1820 we took a house called the Old Manse at Callander.

title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: It was evening when Mr Harry Morton perceived an old woman, wrapped in her tartan plaid, supported by a stout, stupid-looking fellow, in Itoddingrey, approach the house of Milnwood. Old Manse
